result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin K Grandahl

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Erin K Grandahl appeared in court, Attorney William George Weiland appeared in court for Erin K Grandahl. 

22CF30 - Waiver of Preliminary Hearing is conducted at this time: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Erin K Grandahl appeared in court, Attorney William George Weiland appeared in court for Erin K Grandahl. 

22CF30 - Initial Appearance is conducted at this time: 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Atty Weiland indicates they will waive the preliminary hearing.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Erin K Grandahl appeared in court, Attorney William George Weiland appeared in court for Erin K Grandahl. 
Both files heard: 21CF267, 22CF30

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Court questions Atty Pfeil.
Atty Pfeil responds. 
Atty Weiland concurs with agreement stated and makes further statements. 
Defendant concurs with agreements. 

22CF30 - Initial Appearance is conducted at this time: 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Atty Weiland indicates they will waive the preliminary hearing. 

22CF30 - Waiver of Preliminary Hearing is conducted at this time: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Plea and Sentencing continues at this time: 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF267 Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the drug paraphernalia item.
Atty Pfeil concurs. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CF267 Count 1 - Violate Harassment Restraining Order and 21CF267 Count 3 - Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
21CF267 Count 2 and the single count in 22CF30 are dismissed and read-in. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim was present earlier, but left and did provide a statement in the form of bullet points they wanted mentioned.  
Victim Witness Coordinator Jane Iwanski reads the bullet points to the court. 

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant makes statements to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
21CF267 Count 1 - 
45 days jail - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Home monitor after the first 30 days have been served, if she qualifies. 

21CF267 Count 3 - 
10 days jail - STAYED - 
Consecutive to count 1
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Home monitor after the first 30 days have been served, if she qualifies. 

24 months probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Participate in any other counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent
No contact with victim S.M.G. or their residence.
Comply with the conditions of the restraining order.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances unlawfully. 
Only use 1 pharmacy for prescription medications and sign release of information so agen can monitor compliance. 
Pay all costs and surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample. 

Court questions if there is any jail credit. 
Atty Pfeil states there was a riverside hearing on 6/28 and the incident was on 6/24. 

BY THE COURT: 
5 days jail credit may be credited to in custody portion of the jail sentence.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:33 PM Defendant Erin K Grandahl not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Mutchler indicates the defendant has a plea hearing set for March 8 and this case will be rolled in to that.  
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Portage County Justice Programs High Severity Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - S Varga.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - S Varga.
JusticePoint Violation Report - Defendant failed to report for drug testing on 1/28/22 as required
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
